channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed’s expected rate cut today is less about stimulating the economy and more about protecting the job market from ‘shattering’
item.description: A cut is something of an "insurance policy against a shattering of the U.S. labor market," UBS chief economist Paul Donovan said.

item.title: Exclusive: U.S. businesses are getting throttled by the drop in tourism from Canada: ‘I can count the number of Canadian visitors on one hand’
item.description: Canadians traditionally make up the largest group of international tourists to the U.S.

item.title: 5 VCs sounds off on the AI question du jour
item.description: Who better to ask about a bubble than a group who will collectively deploy anywhere from tens to hundreds of millions of dollars over the next decade ...

item.title: Inside tractor maker CNH’s push to bring more artificial intelligence to the farm
item.description: CNH CTO Jay Schroeder says using AI to improve farming is a decades-long passion. "I grew up on a family farm…so for me, it’s personal.”

item.title: Activist investors are disproportionately targeting female CEOs—and it’s costing corporate America dearly
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Silver's at a record. More live coverage of markets.
Aegon to relocate out of the Netherlands to the eastern part of the U.S.
I’m 65. I’ve been maxing out my retirement contributions. When can I slow down?
This bank just halved its bitcoin price target down from $200,000. Here’s why.
Why Tesla’s stock could be a top pick for 2026, even as EV sales struggle
